main event: A Naval ship reported sighting 8-10 unidentified objects in the Pacific Ocean in 1962.
interesting points: The objects were first noticed due to their movement in relation to the stars.
The objects were round, the size of a first magnitude star, and had a solid glow with an orangish-white and yellow cast.
The objects were observed for a full minute, traveling in a south-southeast direction before disappearing behind clouds.
The sighting was made by the Officer of the Deck, the Boatswain of the Watch, the lookout, and the entire bridge watch, who were described as completely reliable.
No aircraft were detected on radar at the time of the sighting.
witnesses: Naval ship crew, including the Officer of the Deck and Boatswain of the Watch
